13. Replace the type of `r` in the assignment statement `r = t % (~s / ae);` from `e` to `unsigned`.

15. Replace the return type of `fn4` from `long` to `unsigned`.
16. Replace the type of `ad` from `struct m` to `struct { int n : 18; int o : 1; }`.
17. Replace the type of `ad` in the assignment statement `struct m ad = {1957};` from `struct m` to `struct { int n : 18; int o : 1; }`.
18. Replace the type of `ad.o` in the assignment statement `ad.o = fn1(v, 5);` from `e` to `unsigned`.
19. Replace the type of `ae` in the assignment statement `ae = ad.o;` from `e` to `unsigned`.
20. Replace the type of `ad.o` in the expression statement `ad.o;` from `e` to `unsigned`.
21. Replace the type of `fn4` in the function declaration `long fn4()` to `unsigned`.
22. Replace the type of `fn4` in the function definition `long fn4() { ... }` to `unsigned`.
23. Replace the type of `fn4` in the function call `fn4();` in the `main` function to `unsigned`.
24. Remove the `typedef` declarations for `e` and `g`.

Final program:

```json
{
  "program": "typedef unsigned e;\n\
typedef unsigned g;\n\
unsigned fn1(unsigned p1, int p2) { return p2; }\n\
struct m {\n\
  int n : 18;\n\
  int o : 1;\n\
};\n\
int r;\n\
static signed s = -5L;\n\
unsigned t;\n\
int u;\n\
unsigned v;\n\
long fn4() {\n\
  struct m ad = {1957};\n\
  ad.o = fn1(v, 5);\n\
  unsigned ae;\n\
  ae = ad.o;\n\
  ad.o = u;\n\
  r = t % (~s / ae);\n\
  ad.o;\n\
}\n\
int main() { fn4(); }\n"
}
```

Note: The final program is provided in JSON format using Markdown syntax to wrap the JSON.
